Job Title: Customer Success Manager

Location: San Francisco Bay Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Customer Service, Sales

Description:
How to Apply
Please submit your application here https://app.dover.io/apply/1fd59372-2352-40bb-8973-491c6695b248/264399c7-14ef-42c1-894c-4b91f77837dd/?rs=15190316 If we‚Äôre interested in moving forward, we‚Äôll get back to you within a week.
Location
Our ideal candidate is a scrappy, self-starter, who‚Äôs comfortable working independently or with a team, based out of our San Francisco office. We are in the office 2-3 days a week, with anchor days being Tuesday and Thursdays.
About Us
Replo helps companies sell on the internet by helping marketing teams automate building and testing customer journeys using AI.
Today, our beachhead is in ecommerce. Thousands of e-commerce companies, from Hexclad to JIF Peanut Butter, use Replo to build everything from their latest product offers to Super Bowl giveaways.
History
Replo was founded in the summer of 2021 by Yuxin Zhu and Noah Gilmore. We launched in 2022 and grew to over 1000+ paying customers in just 6 months, with no sales team.
We‚Äôve raised over $8.2M from Figma, YCombinator, General Catalyst, Infinity Ventures, MAGIC Fund, Base Case Capital, as well as the founders of NextJS/Vercel.
Traction
We are default alive, and continue to grow double-digit % every month.
Founding Team
Yuxin Zhu grew up in New York City and graduated from UC Berkeley (CS ‚Äò15) and prior to Replo ran engineering, product, and design teams at Uber. In his spare time, he likes to listen to audiobooks, play board games, and snowboard in Hokkaido. You‚Äôll find him at his favorite restaurant in Tokyo, Menya Itto.Noah Gilmore grew up in Chicago and also went to Berkeley (EECS ‚Äò15, same dorm as Yuxin!) and prior to Replo was Principal Engineer at Plangrid, a YC company which was acquired by Autodesk in 2019. In his spare time, he likes working on his blog and assortment of iOS apps (you can learn more at https://noahgilmore.com/!)
Why We Exist
The web continues to be the most profitable customer acquisition channel for companies selling services and goods online.Over the last five years, total digital ad spending in the US has more than doubled to $270B, while customer acquisition costs (CAC) have increased over 60%. As competition increases, there are more software platforms and service providers offering analytics and insights than ever before.However, going from this data to actually optimizing customer acquisition remains exceedingly difficult. Marketing teams have to look at numbers, draw the right conclusions, figure out what to test, how to test it, and often wait days or weeks on other stakeholders ‚Äî including design, copywriters, developers, media buyers ‚Äî before they can even launch new ideas.This method is extremely costly and exceedingly slow, because human experience, energy, and time is required at every step on the treadmill of refining customer acquisition. We believe data and AI can not only turn the customer acquisition flywheel ‚Äî it can do so 10x faster, and 100x more cost-effectively than current, human-only methods.That‚Äôs what Replo exists to enable.
Benefits
We offer very competitive cash and equity compensation with healthcare/vision/dental and 401K. We will also provide a stipend for work-from-home gear if you need!
Your responsibilities
Drive adoption, retention, and expansion for a product people love that solves real problems. You‚Äôll work with a mix of customers who are deploying Replo across their company. This ranges from SMBs to enterprise accounts running ads for the Super Bowl.Help build the foundations of Customer Success at Replo You are hire #2 on the team. As an early member of our team, you'll be instrumental in helping define our motion.Manage agency relationships A large part of Replo‚Äôs customer base is freelancers and agencies who help brands. You are responsible for managing and growing these relationships.Do unscalable 0 ‚Üí 1 sales motions Test out interesting upsell and distribution strategies with customers. Hear their feedback and figure out novel ways to partner that can scale.Be a project manager expert Manage contractors and eventually a team to deliver on onboarding projects for large accounts. Definition of large accounts will change over time.Learn our product inside and out and help your customers drive business outcomes. Our product can get complicated since there‚Äôs a ton of integrations, use-cases, you‚Äôll have to understand well.Work very very closely with product/design Provide continuous feedback to the product and design team on how to improve our user experience. If you‚Äôre able to take on projects directly, that‚Äôd be +1 since we have 1 PM and 1 product designer. You will be our eyes/ears on the ground on 10x-ing the product.Drive user research & insights You'll talk constantly users, conduct user interviews, host webinars to understand what they want to do with Replo and the content that‚Äôll help them make it possible.Manage our community Today, there are thousands of freelancers working on Replo. Manage our Slack community of 2000+ users, distribute content, do content collaborations with other partners. Our team is small, but mighty and you‚Äôre expected to make sure everything we do is leveraged.Coordinate with partners Our partners create content all the time on our behalf. Here‚Äôs an example. Make sure that content our content is organized and high-quality.Hopefully have a blast working with us üòá
Looking for someone who
Very comfortable with ambiguity on projects. If we say, here‚Äôs a problem space, go figure this out! We expect clear communication and the ability to ‚Äúfigure shit out‚ÄùComfortable working with sourcing and managing contractors to get things done fast. This involves editing, admin work, etc. The work you do should be super-leveraged at a small startup.A fundamental understanding of basic web development technologies (HTML, CSS, JS) and an ability to learn quickly. Our product can be complex but we expect you to learn it front to back.Has a very product and customer focused mindset.You should be comfortable giving product ideas and design feedback on the productIs self-driven and can roll with the punches in a fast-paced environment where priorities and requirements may change frequently
Bonus points if you
Have a technical backgroundHave been a founder or started your own businessHave worked at an early-stage startup previously (Series A or earlier)An eye for visual design (or past experience in product design, Figma, etc)

Experience Level (if available): None
